titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Benjamin McMurtry, Judgment
CWG5766

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky, Fayette Circuit Court,
August Term 1864, August 8th 1864
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against } On Indictment
Benjamin McMurtry &
William A Lindsay Defendants

The defendant William A Lindsay having been duly summoned and failing to answer, it is adjudged by the Court that that the plaintiff recover of the said William A Lindsay the sum of Five hundred dollars, the debt in the Summons mentioned and also her costs herein expended.

a copy -- Att Jno B Norton c f c c
By Chas F Lowry D C.

Lexington Ky,
August 20 1864
His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Gov Comth Ky
Sir
Herewith enclosed please find copy of Judgment attested by Clerk of the Circuit Court Fayette Co Ky against Mr McMurtry of Lexington Ky, and W. A. Lindsay his surety.

Comth Kentucky
vs. } Copy Judgment
Lindsay Wm A
Remit as to Lindsay
If you can do any thing for my friend Lindsay, who is a perfect gentleman, you will greatly oblige
